original_issue: Hans ID 111: Maybe keep one plot here (consolidation)
diagnosis: Multiple scattered RMSE plots across pages made comparison difficult. Hans requested consolidation into single figure.
new_insight: Resample regime yields RMSE 7-12 across modes, substantially lower than baseline (~16). The nonlinear x² mode shows highest RMSE (~12). Bar comparison clearly shows regime differences.

patch.latex_caption: Comparison of post-assimilation RMSE between the Resample regime and the baseline (no assimilation) across observation modes.

original_issue: Hans ID 114: which model is in the figure?
diagnosis: Original figures lacked model/architecture specification in caption and legend. Hans requested explicit labeling.
new_insight: GRU, LSTM, and MLP architectures show similar performance (within 1 RMSE unit). No clear winner among architectures. All three follow same pattern: x² mode hardest, x mode easiest.

patch.latex_caption: Post-assimilation RMSE by architecture and noise level for each observation mode (Resample regime).

original_issue: Hans ID 105: can you make it a log plot? + ID 107: something is wrong here
diagnosis: Original linear-scale plot made FixedMean divergence appear as 'wrong' data. Log scale reveals the actual behavior: FixedMean RMSE > 10^5 while Resample remains < 20.
new_insight: FixedMean regime exhibits complete divergence across ALL configurations (RMSE > 700,000). This is NOT an error but reflects the fundamental inability of the network to produce meaningful estimates without informative background. Resample regime shows stable behavior (RMSE 7-14).

patch.latex_caption: Comparison of post-assimilation RMSE between the Resample and FixedMean regimes (logarithmic scale). The FixedMean regime exhibits complete divergence with RMSE exceeding $10^5$.

original_issue: Hans meeting feedback: Focus on single clear metric (RMSE)
diagnosis: Original report used multiple metrics without clear focus. Hans emphasized RMSE as the core comparison metric.
new_insight: Mean improvement is NEGATIVE for most configurations (-0.07% to -0.72%). This indicates the network does not consistently improve upon the background. Isolated positive cases (MLP/x mode: +0.6%) are not consistent across noise levels.

patch.latex_caption: Mean improvement percentage by observation mode and architecture. Negative values indicate that the analysis is worse than the background.
